title: Freight Transport Quiz
description: Test your recall of how goods are moved around the world by land, sea, and air

questions.question: The standard intermodal shipping container is most commonly how many feet long?
A 'semi-trailer truck' in the United States is commonly called what?
The Panama Canal connects which two bodies of water?
What type of freight car is an open-top rail car used for hauling bulk materials like coal?
A 'reefer' in the shipping industry refers to what type of container or truck?
The Suez Canal is located in which country?
What does 'LTL' stand for in the freight industry?
The world's largest cargo planes, like the Antonov An-225, are used to transport what?
A 'bulk carrier' ship is designed to transport what kind of cargo?
options: Unpackaged bulk commodities like grain or ore

questions.question: The 'piggyback' method in freight refers to transporting what on a train?
Which company operates the largest fleet of delivery trucks in the United States?
A 'tanker truck' on the highway is typically carrying what?
options: Liquids such as fuel, milk, or chemicals

questions.question: The 'Silk Road' was an ancient trade route connecting China to which region?
What is 'intermodal transport'?
options: Transport of passengers and freight together
Transport using two or more modes (truck, rail, ship) without handling the cargo itself
Transport using only one type of vehicle

questions.question: A 'forklift' is commonly used in warehouses and freight yards to do what?
options: Lift and move heavy pallets and containers
